rComments: Bin was not a good professor. Lectures were very dry and hard to understand due to her english and lack of enthusiasm. The class in general is very interesting so I just read everything in the book! Going to class is pretty much pointless. Get ready to study from the book if you're going to have her!

Be prepared to teach yourself via textbook. Do attend lecture as she will go over what she expects you to know as well as give examples which appear on the midtermfinal. Memorize the textbook quizzes as they make up majority of the tests. Study homework and old tests for free response. SectionOH are useless. Class was weighted 252550.

Dr. Chen is a very knowledgable professor! For the exams, review her ppt slides and make sure to go to lectures in order to understand the graphs on her slides. Overall, made the first neuroscience course I've taken enjoyable. Curves a ton!

The subject material is extremely interesting, especially for the first half. However's Bin cannot teach and the lectures are jumbled. She expects a lot. The online quizzes are gold. You teach yourself using the textbook. If this class is not required, avoid it.

awesome class, great professor. I promise you get used to her accent. Class attendance is a must, 1/3 of the class shows up to lecture, 1/3 of the students are getting A's and B's and learning some of the most interesting, least dry aspects of biology. Tests fair. got mad respect for this woman, she works for NASA even. an honor to be taught by her

Bin genuinely cares about her students, she really took the time to explain and make sure students understood the material at hand. Study the lecture slides and old practice exam if you want to do well on the exams. Bin does curve the class. This class otherwise has been one of the most informative and interesting bio classes I've taken

she still should improve her English speaking and teaching. also she recycles the true/false and mc part of old tests, which can come from any random part of the book. the short answers are confusing and hard, but always related to deficits or damages in the brain. always go to section and read the book. lectures are skippable.

Prof. Chen is really nice and I know she is a brilliant woman in her field. As a professor, she seems really inexperienced and makes a lot of cliched bad professor mistakes: monotonous, reads right from power points, doesn't speak clearly or elaborate on material. Her class is pretty difficult and she doesn't give study sheets. Go to section and re

Worst. Teacher. Ever. She cannot speak english, reads straight off powerpoints, and when I went to her office hours to ask a question about the test she said "well, i put the answers online. look there." my evaluation said "see letter grade." thats it!  just that! would it kill her to put 5 minutes of effort into teaching? apparently!!!!!

Worst. Teacher. Ever. She cannot speak english, reads straight off powerpoints, and when I went to her office hours to ask a question about the test she said "well, i put the answers online. look there." my evaluation said "see letter grade." thats it!  just that! would it kill her to put 5 minutes of effort into teaching? apparently!!!!!
Good coverage of basic neuroscience information. Prof. Chen struggles a bit with her teaching style but I am sure she will improve with practice.

Class is interesting but hard. Teaching has lot of improvement to do. You need to be sympathetic with the professor since English is not first language and it is hard to comprehend. TA's are very nice and competent. Be prepared to read your books as exams do not always come from lectures only. Prelim 1:easy, Prelim 2:hard, Prelim 3 is comp. & hard.

You need to read lectures slides + entire text to do good on exam as lots of items are not in the lecture (or the slides). 2 exams (100 points each) and 1 comprehensive finals (200 points). Midterm 1 mean was 76; Midterm 2 means was 56; Finals mean was 110. Hard class. I am an A- student but I got a C in this class.
